intro: Erica puberuliflora, commonly known as the woolly heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape region, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Erica puberuliflora thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires minimal water once established. It is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
